newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian blue chips climb, further gains seen.
newsitem.headline: Latvian blue chips climb, further gains seen.

text.p: All Latvian blue chips gained in moderate trade on Friday, leaving dealers cautiously hopeful that the bears of summer had finally gone into hibernation.
The Rietumu index climbed 0.9 percent to 152.42 while the market turned over 95,000 lats against 81,000 lats on Thursday.
Blue chips led the way, with all five of the six official list stocks that were quoted during the session rising.
"Unibanka has been rising steadily and now other blue chips look comparatively cheap...that has prompted some interest," said one dealer.
"Most blue chips should rise more next week, though Unibanka may slow down...it may be reaching its limit," said another broker.
Unibanka was most traded at 50,200 lats to add two santimes to 3.42 lats.
Staburadze confectionery added 1.5 percent to 2.75 lats in trade of 17,900 lats. Kaija Fish Cannery was the biggest blue chip gainer, rising 1.9 percent to 2.16 lats on light turnover of 3,600 lats.
On the secondary list, Valmiera Glassfibre inched up to 1.37 lats from 1.35 in trade of 8,500 lats.
